title: Chorley Council: £338 Million in Supplier Payments Analysed
summary: Chorley Borough Council has paid £338 million to 1,786 suppliers across 17,212 transactions. One supplier — Lancashire County Council — accounts for nearly 44% of all spending.
author: Chorley Council Transparency

title: Chorley Procurement: 87 Late Publications and 7 Weak Competition Flags
summary: Our analysis of Chorley's procurement notices reveals 87 contracts published after their award date — some by over 300 days — and 7 contracts showing weak competition indicators.
author: Chorley Council Transparency

title: Chorley's Duplicate Payment Analysis: £73K Flagged
summary: Our analysis identified £73,000 in likely duplicate payments across 183 groups, plus a further £95,400 in possible duplicates requiring investigation.
author: Chorley Council Transparency

title: Chorley and South Ribble: The Shared Services Partnership
summary: Chorley paid £19.3 million to South Ribble Borough Council and vice versa — part of a formal shared services arrangement that makes both councils' spending patterns unique.
author: Chorley Council Transparency

title: When Chorley Pays: Payment Pattern Analysis
summary: Wednesday is Chorley's busiest payment day with 10,692 transactions worth £121 million. Our analysis also found 11 suppliers paid within 14 days on average — the "rapid payers" club.
author: Chorley Council Transparency
